page.title: 15Real Ale,The 3 Horseshoes
page.content: The Campaign for Real Ale (C.A.M.R.A.) was formed in 1971 to preserve and promote real ale-brewed from malt and hops and served without high pressure gas as fewer than half of Britain's pubs served real ale. The 3 Horseshoes pub at Kempston West End has been listed in CAMRA's "Good Beer Guide" for the last 12 years and many of its regulars swear it serves the best pint in Bedfordshire! A small country pub,only a handful of customers come from the immediate farming area,most come from Bromham, Wootton, Kempston, Cranfield and Bedford.There has been a pub here for over 100 years, originally there were 4 buildings and pigs were kept but today there is only the one building which was stuck by lightning in 1983 and the pub was closed for 9 weeks.
